Other than antivirals, there is also controversy surrounding the use of topical steroids to treat adenoviral infection. Although topical steroids can speed the resolution of the signs and relieve symptoms, it is associated with increased viral shedding and duration of active viral infection beyond the typical 12 days, meaning the patient is infectious for longer.
